titlStmt.titl: Harris 1989 American Teacher Survey, study no. 892014

citation.biblCit: Louis Harris and Associates, Inc., 1989, "Harris 1989 American Teacher Survey, study no. 892014", http://hdl.handle.net/1902.29/H-892014 UNF:3:y9OyckQBhrX7obVK/oP7pA== Odum Institute [Distributor] V2 [Version]

titlStmt.titl: Harris 1989 American Teacher Survey, study no. 892014

stdyInfo.abstract: This is the sixth in a series of surveys focusing on the teaching profession. This one focuses on the changes within the educational systems, problems teachers face in the classroom, and how these problems should be addressed. Variables include principle- teacher relationship, professional status, working conditions, educational reform, and job satisfaction.

method.notes: Telephone surveys of school teachers in grades K through 12

useStmt.citReq: Research publications, news or magazine articles and radio or television broadcasts employing statistical summaries of the Odum Institute data should give an appropriate citation to the Institute as the source of the data.

var.name: S1
var.labl: FROM OBSERVATION: Respondent sex

var.name: Q1
var.labl: Do you teach in an elementary school, a junior high or middle school, or a high school?

catgry.labl: Both junior high and high school

var.name: Q2
var.labl: Thinking about the public school in which you teach, how would you rate the quality of education in your school -- excellent, good, only fair or poor?

var.name: A1_A
var.labl: Here are some suggestions people have made about improving the role of principals. For each, please say whether you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Principals should have greater control over the rules governing their school

var.name: A1_B
var.labl: Here are some suggestions people have made about improving the role of principals. For each, please say whether you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Ultimately, the principal should be held accountable for everything that happens to the children in his or her school

var.name: A1_C
var.labl: Here are some suggestions people have made about improving the role of principals. For each, please say whether you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Principals should teach at least some classes on a regular basis

var.name: A1_D
var.labl: Here are some suggestions people have made about improving the role of principals. For each, please say whether you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Every school should establish a leadership committee of principals, teachers, and students to set and enforce rules

var.name: A1_E
var.labl: Here are some suggestions people have made about improving the role of principals. For each, please say whether you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Principals ought to share decision making responsibility for budgetary matters with the superintendent and the school board

var.name: A1_F
var.labl: Here are some suggestions people have made about improving the role of principals. For each, please say whether you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Principals and teachers should share time together after the school day to formally plan staff development, curriculum and management

var.name: B1_1
var.labl: I would like to read you some statements people have made about their jobs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly with the statement as it relates to your own job as a teacher in the public schools. -- I would advise a young person to pursue a career in teaching

var.name: B1_2
var.labl: I would like to read you some statements people have made about their jobs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly with the statement as it relates to your own job as a teacher in the public schools. -- I love to teach

var.name: B1_3
var.labl: I would like to read you some statements people have made about their jobs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly with the statement as it relates to your own job as a teacher in the public schools. -- As a teacher, I feel respected in today's society

var.name: B1_4
var.labl: I would like to read you some statements people have made about their jobs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly with the statement as it relates to your own job as a teacher in the public schools. -- Most of my fellow teachers are dedicated to their work

var.name: B1_5
var.labl: I would like to read you some statements people have made about their jobs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly with the statement as it relates to your own job as a teacher in the public schools. -- My job allows me the opportunity to earn a decent salary

var.name: B1_6
var.labl: I would like to read you some statements people have made about their jobs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly with the statement as it relates to your own job as a teacher in the public schools. -- Ultimately, the teacher should be held accountable for the academic success or failure of the children in his or her class

var.name: B2_A
var.labl: Here are some things that might possibly help teachers do their job better. Compared with three years ago, is your school better or worse at (READ EACH ITEM)? -- Having more structured and organized time to talk with colleagues about professional matters

var.name: B2_B
var.labl: Here are some things that might possibly help teachers do their job better. Compared with three years ago, is your school better or worse at (READ EACH ITEM)? -- Having teachers able to observe each other in the classroom and provide feedback to each other

var.name: B2_C
var.labl: Here are some things that might possibly help teachers do their job better. Compared with three years ago, is your school better or worse at (READ EACH ITEM)? -- Reducing the time teachers need to spend on administrative tasks

var.name: B2_D
var.labl: Here are some things that might possibly help teachers do their job better. Compared with three years ago, is your school better or worse at (READ EACH ITEM)? -- Providing a smaller class size

var.name: B2_E
var.labl: Here are some things that might possibly help teachers do their job better. Compared with three years ago, is your school better or worse at (READ EACH ITEM)? -- Having teachers work as 'teams' rather than teaching all classes or subjects alone

var.name: B3_1
var.labl: Some say that alternatives to traditional student teaching programs such as clinical training programs, professional development schools or professional practice schools could be the wave of the future in teacher training. I am going to read to you some ways these programs can be designed. For each, would you tell me if you think it would improve teacher training, or not? (READ EACH ITEM) -- Schools jointly operated by a university and a school district whose responsibility would be to train teachers

var.name: B3_2
var.labl: Some say that alternatives to traditional student teaching programs such as clinical training programs, professional development schools or professional practice schools could be the wave of the future in teacher training. I am going to read to you some ways these programs can be designed. For each, would you tell me if you think it would improve teacher training, or not? (READ EACH ITEM) -- A full-time, year-round on-the-job training program that prospective teachers would participate in prior to graduation

var.name: B3_3
var.labl: Some say that alternatives to traditional student teaching programs such as clinical training programs, professional development schools or professional practice schools could be the wave of the future in teacher training. I am going to read to you some ways these programs can be designed. For each, would you tell me if you think it would improve teacher training, or not? (READ EACH ITEM) -- A full-time, year-round program, that teachers would participate in after graduation, but prior to certification

var.name: C1
var.labl: Do you think overall government funding for education in your school is sufficient or not?

var.name: C2
var.labl: If there was no increase in funding, would you prefer to see fewer special government-mandated programs with more money available for general education purposes, OR more special government-mandated programs and less money available for general education?

catgry.labl: Fwr mndtd-prgrms, mr mny t gnrl
Mr mndtd prgrms, lss mny t gnrl dctn

var.name: C3_1
var.labl: In the future, which two of the following services would you most like to see have added funding in your school? (CHECK TWO) -- Social workers and family services

var.name: C3_2
var.labl: In the future, which two of the following services would you most like to see have added funding in your school? (CHECK TWO) -- Remedial programs

var.name: C3_3
var.labl: In the future, which two of the following services would you most like to see have added funding in your school? (CHECK TWO) -- Health services

var.name: C3_4
var.labl: In the future, which two of the following services would you most like to see have added funding in your school? (CHECK TWO) -- Arts programs

var.name: C3_5

var.name: C3_10
var.labl: In the future, which two of the following services would you most like to see have added funding in your school? (CHECK TWO) -- Not sure

var.name: C4_A
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- Overcrowded classes

var.name: C4_B
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- Student absenteeism

var.name: C4_C
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- The number of students who lack basic skills

var.name: C4_D
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- The number of children who are left on their own after school

var.name: C4_E
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- The number of dropouts

var.name: C4_F
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- The number of teenage pregnancies

var.name: C4_G
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- The amount of drinking by students

var.name: C4_H
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- The number of students using drugs

var.name: C4_I
var.labl: Now I am going to read some things that people have said are problems with public schools. After I read each one, please tell me if you think that problem is very serious, somewhat serious, not very serious, or not at all serious at your school? -- The number of teenage suicides

var.name: C5
var.labl: Which one of the following changes in your school's community would have the most beneficial effect on education in your school?

var.name: D1
var.labl: Now some questions about career ladder programs. These programs divide teaching into different jobs and then provide different ranks and different salaries according to the level of responsibility. Does your school have a career ladder program or not?

var.name: D2_A
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding career ladder programs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Career ladder programs improve teachers' chances for professional growth and development

var.name: D2_B
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding career ladder programs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- the methods used to select teachers for career ladder programs are unfair and non-objective

var.name: D2_C
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding career ladder programs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Teachers have a real say in the development and operation of career ladder programs

var.name: D2_D
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding career ladder programs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- career ladder programs create artificial and unfortunate distinctions among teachers

var.name: D3
var.labl: Overall, do you personally favor or oppose career ladder programs?

var.name: D4
var.labl: Now some questions about merit pay systems. These systems select a certain number of teachers as meritorious and then pay them a greater amount of money with no change in their duties. Does your school use merit pay systems, or not?

var.name: D5_A
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding merit pay systems. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Merit pay systems provide valuable incentives for teachers to improve their performance

var.name: D5_B
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding merit pay systems. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Merit pay systems create artificial and unfortunate distinctions among teachers

var.name: D5_C
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding merit pay systems. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- merit pay systems recognize and reward outstanding quality teachers

var.name: D5_D
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding merit pay systems. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- The means that are used to select the teachers for merit pay tend to be unfair and non-objective

var.name: D6
var.labl: Overall, do you personally favor or oppose merit pay systems?

var.name: D7
var.labl: Now some questions about mentor teacher programs. These programs designate certain teachers to perform special one-on-one professional coaching for other teachers. Does your school have a mentor teacher program or not?

var.name: D8_A
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding mentor teacher programs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Mentor teacher programs help to improve the teaching skills of new teachers

var.name: D8_B
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding mentor teacher programs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Mentor teacher programs create artificial and unfortunate distinctions among teachers

var.name: D8_C
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding mentor teacher programs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Mentor teacher programs are a good way to continue coaching for all teachers no matter how experienced they are

var.name: D8_D
var.labl: Here are some statements regarding mentor teacher programs. For each, please tell me if you agree strongly, agree somewhat, disagree somewhat, or disagree strongly -- Becoming a mentor teacher is too much of a short-term position instead of a permanent career advancement

var.name: D9
var.labl: Overall, do you personally favor or oppose mentor teacher programs?

var.name: D10_A
var.labl: I will now mention some reforms that might be adopted in the future to attract and retain good people in teaching. For each please tell me whether you think that reform would help a lot, help a little, or would not help at all to attract and retain good teachers -- Allowing school districts to hire talented administrators from fields other than education

var.name: D10_B
var.labl: I will now mention some reforms that might be adopted in the future to attract and retain good people in teaching. For each please tell me whether you think that reform would help a lot, help a little, or would not help at all to attract and retain good teachers -- Allowing school districts to hire talented people to teach who are not certified teachers

var.name: D10_C
var.labl: I will now mention some reforms that might be adopted in the future to attract and retain good people in teaching. For each please tell me whether you think that reform would help a lot, help a little, or would not help at all to attract and retain good teachers -- Requiring periodic retesting of teachers in their subject matter

var.name: D10_D
var.labl: I will now mention some reforms that might be adopted in the future to attract and retain good people in teaching. For each please tell me whether you think that reform would help a lot, help a little, or would not help at all to attract and retain good teachers -- Making it easier for incompetent administrators to be removed

var.name: D10_E
var.labl: I will now mention some reforms that might be adopted in the future to attract and retain good people in teaching. For each please tell me whether you think that reform would help a lot, help a little, or would not help at all to attract and retain good teachers -- Making it easier for incompetent teachers to be removed

var.name: D11_1
var.labl: As the problems of at-risk students mount, some say that in the future integrated, collaborative health, education and social services in schools will be the key to helping these students. Please tell me if you agree or disagree with each of the following statements about integrated services in schools -- Bureaucracies are such that you could never get them to work together

var.name: D11_2
var.labl: As the problems of at-risk students mount, some say that in the future integrated, collaborative health, education and social services in schools will be the key to helping these students. Please tell me if you agree or disagree with each of the following statements about integrated services in schools -- Schools shouldn't have this responsibility. They should focus on academics and not social services

var.name: D11_3
var.labl: As the problems of at-risk students mount, some say that in the future integrated, collaborative health, education and social services in schools will be the key to helping these students. Please tell me if you agree or disagree with each of the following statements about integrated services in schools -- At-risk students aren't comfortable with seeking these services on school grounds

var.name: D11_4
var.labl: As the problems of at-risk students mount, some say that in the future integrated, collaborative health, education and social services in schools will be the key to helping these students. Please tell me if you agree or disagree with each of the following statements about integrated services in schools -- This would be a smart way of keeping at-risk students from slipping through the cracks

var.name: D11_5
var.labl: As the problems of at-risk students mount, some say that in the future integrated, collaborative health, education and social services in schools will be the key to helping these students. Please tell me if you agree or disagree with each of the following statements about integrated services in schools -- Schools should mobilize these resources so that they can refer their students to them, but should not be expected to provide for all social, human needs

var.name: D12_A
var.labl: Here are some more suggestions that might possibly improve education in the future. For each tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all to improve education? -- Allowing parents and students to choose the school the students want to attend

var.name: D12_B
var.labl: Here are some more suggestions that might possibly improve education in the future. For each tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all to improve education? -- Establishing magnet or regional schools with specialized curricula

var.name: D12_C
var.labl: Here are some more suggestions that might possibly improve education in the future. For each tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all to improve education? -- Developing different approaches to education outside the traditional school

var.name: D12_D
var.labl: Here are some more suggestions that might possibly improve education in the future. For each tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all to improve education? -- Increasing the number of students who study such things as computer literacy and foreign languages

var.name: D12_E
var.labl: Here are some more suggestions that might possibly improve education in the future. For each tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all to improve education? -- Restructuring classes on the basis of proficiency instead of age

var.name: D13_A
var.labl: Here are some programs that might help students make the transition to work. For each, tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all in students' transition to work? -- Providing more direct links to job training and jobs

var.name: D13_B
var.labl: Here are some programs that might help students make the transition to work. For each, tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all in students' transition to work? -- Creating programs in which students can go to school part of the day and work at a job part of the day

var.name: D13_C
var.labl: Here are some programs that might help students make the transition to work. For each, tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all in students' transition to work? -- Bringing working people into schools to discuss their careers with students

var.name: D13_D
var.labl: Here are some programs that might help students make the transition to work. For each, tell me whether you think it would help a lot, help some, not help much, or not help at all in students' transition to work? -- Requiring community service as part of the high school curriculum

var.name: D14
var.labl: During the past several years, there have been many proposals for educational reform such as the ones I have been asking about. Has your state enacted any educational reforms?

var.name: D15
var.labl: Have any of these reforms actually been implemented yet in the school in which you teach?

var.name: D16
var.labl: On the whole, would you say the education reforms in your school have had a positive effect, negative effect, or not much effect on students?

var.name: D17
var.labl: Would you say the educational reforms in your school have had a positive effect, negative effect, or not much effect on teachers?

var.name: D18
var.labl: Which one reform has had the most positive effect?

var.name: D19
var.labl: Which one reform has had the most negative effect?

var.name: E1
var.labl: Within the next five years, how likely is it that you will leave the teaching profession to go into some different occupation -- very likely, fairly likely, not too likely, or not at all likely?

var.name: E2
var.labl: All in all, how satisfied would you say you are with teaching as a career -- very satisfied, somewhat satisfied, somewhat dissatisfied, or very dissatisfied?

var.name: E3_1
var.labl: On the whole, are you optimistic or pessimistic that (READ EACH ITEM) will be better five years from now? -- The principal-teacher relationship

var.labl: On the whole, are you optimistic or pessimistic that (READ EACH ITEM) will be better five years from now? -- The professional status of teachers

var.name: E3_3
var.labl: On the whole, are you optimistic or pessimistic that (READ EACH ITEM) will be better five years from now? -- Working conditions for teachers

var.name: E3_4
var.labl: On the whole, are you optimistic or pessimistic that (READ EACH ITEM) will be better five years from now? -- Educational changes

var.name: E3_5
var.labl: On the whole, are you optimistic or pessimistic that (READ EACH ITEM) will be better five years from now? -- The job satisfaction of teachers

var.name: E3_6
var.labl: On the whole, are you optimistic or pessimistic that (READ EACH ITEM) will be better five years from now? -- The quality of teaching in your school

var.name: E3_7
var.labl: On the whole, are you optimistic or pessimistic that (READ EACH ITEM) will be better five years from now? -- The educational performance of students

var.name: F2
var.labl: Is the area where your school is located considered inner city, urban, suburban, small town, or rural?

var.name: F3
var.labl: How many students in your school come from families whose income is below the average of the community -- all of them, many of them, some of them, only a few, or none?

var.name: F4
var.labl: How many students in your school are from minority families all of them, many of them, some of them, only a few, or none?

var.name: F5
var.labl: Are you a member of a teachers' union, or not?

var.name: F6
var.labl: Do you consider yourself of Hispanic origin or descent, or not?

var.name: F7
var.labl: Do you consider yourself White, Black, Asian, or what?

var.name: F8
var.labl: Which of the following income categories best describes the 1988 income you derived from teaching, before taxes. Was it (READ LIST)?
